durable_growth.name: durable_growth
durable_growth.description: Optimistic scenario: Refugee ceilings rise to 150,000 by FY2030, ND resettlement capacity fully recovers over 5 years (Global Refuge expansion), and 72.5% of parolees regularize to permanent status.

refugee_ceiling.description: Rising ceilings to 150K by FY2030, sustained

parole_cliff.name: parole_cliff
parole_cliff.description: Parole-heavy scenario: Current parole programs (U4U, OAW) wind down, new parole limited. Near-term high arrivals followed by departure cliff at years 2-4 as temporary status expires without regularization pathway.

restriction.name: restriction
restriction.description: Restrictive scenario: Refugee ceilings remain at 2017-2020 levels (15-30K), ND capacity remains at LSSND-closure level (67%), parole programs terminated, minimal regularization pathway (30%).

refugee_ceiling.description: Low ceilings sustained at Restriction-era levels

welcome_corps.name: welcome_corps
welcome_corps.description: Private sponsorship scenario: Moderate traditional ceilings (100K), but Welcome Corps private sponsorship grows 20% annually, adding supplemental resettlement capacity outside traditional agencies.

refugee_ceiling.description: Stable moderate ceilings with private sponsorship growth

status_quo.name: status_quo
status_quo.description: Baseline scenario: Current policy trajectory continues - 125K ceilings with partial achievement (~60%), existing parole programs continue with uncertainty, partial capacity recovery, central regularization estimate.

policy_lever_mapping.refugee_ceiling: Affects durable component through ND share allocation
policy_lever_mapping.parole_continuation: Affects temporary component size and cliff timing
policy_lever_mapping.regularization_probability: Converts temporary to durable over time
policy_lever_mapping.capacity_multiplier: Scales all arrivals based on local infrastructure

decisions.decision: Using ND share = 0.0071 for refugee allocation
decisions.rationale: Historical share during stable period (2010-2019) before LSSND closure

decisions.decision: Built 5 named policy scenarios with mechanism-based parameters
decisions.rationale: Replace generic growth scenarios with explicit policy levers

decisions.decision: Ran Monte Carlo projections with 1000 simulations per scenario
decisions.evidence: Random seed fixed at 42 for reproducibility

next_steps: Integrate projections with cohort-component model for age structure
Develop interactive scenario dashboard for stakeholder exploration
Monitor policy developments and update scenario parameters
Validate Welcome Corps assumptions as program matures
Connect to workforce and fiscal impact modules
